revised_title: Morphology and Function of Air-Bladder and Weberian Ossicles in Siluroid Fishes
tldr: The authors conducted a detailed study of the morphology and function of the air-bladder and Weberian ossicles in 100 species of Siluroid fishes, belonging to 51 genera. They examined the variations in these structures and their associated skeletal modifications, aiming to provide a basis for understanding their physiological significance and potential impact on the auditory system of these fish species.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate morphology
